Package com.dca.checkers.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dca.checkers.model.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class represents a game state for checkers. A standard checker board is 8 x 8 (64) tiles, alternating white/black. Checkers are only allowed on black tiles and can therefore only move diagonally. The board is optimized to use as little memory space as possible and only uses 3 integers to represent the state of the board (3 bits for each of the 32 tiles). This makes it fast and efficient to copy() the board state.

    This class uses integers to represent the state of each tile and specifically uses these constants for IDs: EMPTY, BLACK_CHECKER, WHITE_CHECKER, BLACK_KING, WHITE_KING.

    Tile states can be retrieved through get(int) and get(int, int). Tile states can be set through set(int, int) and set(int, int, int). The entire game can be reset with reset().

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int BLACK_CHECKER

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Board copy()
        Creates an exact copy of the board. Any changes made to the copy will not affect the current object.
        Returns:
        a copy of this checker board.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the checker board to the original game state with black checkers on top and white on the bottom. There are both 12 black checkers and 12 white checkers.

      • find

        public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> find​(int id)
        Searches through the checker board and finds black tiles that match the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to search for.
        Returns:
        a list of points on the board with the specified ID. If none exist, an empty list is returned.

      • set

        public void set​(int x,
                int y,
                int id)
        Sets the ID of a black tile on the board at the specified location. If the location is not a black tile, nothing is updated. If the ID is less than 0, the board at the location will be set to EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        y - the y-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        id - the new ID to set the black tile to.
        See Also:
        set(int, int)

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                int id)
        Sets the ID of a black tile on the board at the specified location. If the location is not a black tile, nothing is updated. If the ID is less than 0, the board at the location will be set to EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the black tile (from 0 to 31 inclusive).
        id - the new ID to set the black tile to.
        See Also:
        set(int, int, int)

      • get

        public int get​(int x,
               int y)
        Gets the ID corresponding to the specified point on the checker board.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        y - the y-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        Returns:
        the ID at the specified location or INVALID if the location is not on the board or the location is a white tile.
        See Also:
        get(int), set(int, int), set(int, int, int)

      • get

        public int get​(int index)
        Gets the ID corresponding to the specified point on the checker board.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the black tile (from 0 to 31 inclusive).
        Returns:
        the ID at the specified location or INVALID if the location is not on the board.
        See Also:
        get(int, int), set(int, int), set(int, int, int)

      • toPoint

        public static java.awt.Point toPoint​(int index)
        Converts a black tile index (0 to 31 inclusive) to an (x, y) point, such that index 0 is (1, 0), index 1 is (3, 0), ... index 31 is (7, 7).
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the black tile to convert to a point.
        Returns:
        the (x, y) point corresponding to the black tile index or the point (-1, -1) if the index is not between 0 - 31 (inclusive).
        See Also:
        toIndex(int, int), toIndex(Point)

      • toIndex

        public static int toIndex​(int x,
                          int y)
        Converts a point to an index of a black tile on the checker board, such that (1, 0) is index 0, (3, 0) is index 1, ... (7, 7) is index 31.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        y - the y-coordinate on the board (from 0 to 7 inclusive).
        Returns:
        the index of the black tile or -1 if the point is not a black tile.
        See Also:
        toIndex(Point), toPoint(int)

      • toIndex

        public static int toIndex​(java.awt.Point p)
        Converts a point to an index of a black tile on the checker board, such that (1, 0) is index 0, (3, 0) is index 1, ... (7, 7) is index 31.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to convert to an index.
        Returns:
        the index of the black tile or -1 if the point is not a black tile.
        See Also:
        toIndex(int, int), toPoint(int)

      • setBit

        public static int setBit​(int target,
                         int bit,
                         boolean set)
        Sets or clears the specified bit in the target value and returns the updated value.
        Parameters:
        target - the target value to update.
        bit - the bit to update (from 0 to 31 inclusive).
        set - true to set the bit, false to clear the bit.
        Returns:
        the updated target value with the bit set or cleared.
        See Also:
        getBit(int, int)

      • getBit

        public static int getBit​(int target,
                         int bit)
        Gets the state of a bit and determines if it is set (1) or not (0).
        Parameters:
        target - the target value to get the bit from.
        bit - the bit to get (from 0 to 31 inclusive).
        Returns:
        1 if and only if the specified bit is set, 0 otherwise.
        See Also:
        setBit(int, int, boolean)

      • middle

        public static java.awt.Point middle​(java.awt.Point p1,
                                    java.awt.Point p2)
        Gets the middle point on the checker board between two points.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the first point of a black tile on the checker board.
        p2 - the second point of a black tile on the checker board.
        Returns:
        the middle point between two points or (-1, -1) if the points are not on the board, are not distance 2 from each other in x and y, or are on a white tile.
        See Also:
        middle(int, int), middle(int, int, int, int)

        Returns:

        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isValidPoint

        public static boolean isValidPoint​(java.awt.Point testPoint)
        Checks if a point corresponds to a black tile on the checker board.
        Parameters:
        testPoint - the point to check.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the point is on the board, specifically on a black tile.

      • isSafe

        public boolean isSafe​(java.awt.Point checker)
        Checks if the specified checker is safe (i.e. the opponent cannot skip the checker).
        Parameters:
        checker - the point where the test checker is located at.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the checker at the point is safe.

                           int endIndex)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
